name: VR: Vacate the Room (Virtual Reality Escape)
description: VR: Vacate the Room is a short Escape the Room game.It is a VR Experience where you need to find clues to solve puzzles and find your way out.
minimum_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 Processor: Intel® i5-4590, AMD FX 8350 equivalent or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce® GTX 970, AMD Radeon™ R9 290 equivalent or better, Video Output: HDMI 1.4, DisplayPort 1.2 or newer Storage: 250 MB available space Additional Notes: 1x USB 2.0 or better port also required
recommended_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

reviews.review_text: Even if the graphics are not as best as they can be, this game for me is what VR is all about. Room scale exploration was invented for these types of games. This is the game I enjoyed most to be honest. I think 'quests' and room escapes are much more suitable for VR than timer based, you are in the middle, teleport style FPS games. I really forgot I was not in the room, this was fenomenal. I WANT MORE!

Short but brilliant. The whole point of the game is your stuck within a small room and you have one objective, getting out. To do so you must use your brain to find clues and solve puzzles. The visuals are nice and overall the game is really well put together. If you are a fan of real life escape rooms or even digital ones, pick up this game. Well worth the 5 bucks for the experience.
Very nice little puzzle game. It demonstrates well the new gameplay dimension offered by room scale VR. Keep going, I want more!

This was really well done. If you are a fan of escape rooms, I would definitely recommend it.  Yes, admittedly, it is short. It is one small room with a normal mode and a bonus mode. It took me a little under 45 minutes to complete both. (If you have no experience with escape rooms, it might take longer.)  However, compared to the price of an actual escape room (usually around $30 per person for an hour max), $5.00 is nothing.   Also, I thought using a very small room as the dev did was very effective and kept everything within your reach. Very immersive.  All in all, I enjoyed my time and look forward for another release from this creator. Thanks.

The puzzle is a bit easy, and picking up stuffs from the floor can be hard. So do not throw everything off to the floor. :) overall, it is a very pleasant experience. Hopefully, in the future, the room can be larger, with some teleportation function.
Very short game. Takes about 7-15 mins! Good fun. I wonder how you make a game for this VR??
The best escape room we have played. I always use this one to show new friends how the vive works. Great job!

Not a bad experience for $4.  Only main issue is the floor tracking. If you drop an item, you could spend the next few minutes trying to push it with other items so it is in your reach. Maybe my floor tracking is just screwed up.

It's not one hr playtime that's for sure. Not many puzzles, one good one. Only took me 30mins and was 5mins at the start just looking everywhere finding things. Thought it was going to be longer by the other reviews. In fact I was standing thinking that can't be it. Way over priced. $2 at the most.

I know it would not be long before this kind of puzzle games would show up because they are perfect for room-scale VR! Would love to see this kind of game polished and with at least an hour or two of gameplay.
